speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Why, how now, Dromio.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Where runn’st thou so fast?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Do you know me, sir? Am I

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Dromio? Am I your man? Am I myself?

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Thou art Dromio, thou art

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: my man, thou art thyself.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: I am an ass, I am a woman’s

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: man, and besides myself.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: What woman’s man? And

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: how besides thyself?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Marry, sir, besides myself I am

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: due to a woman, one that claims me, one that

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: haunts me, one that will have me.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: What claim lays she to thee?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Marry, sir, such claim as you

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: would lay to your horse, and she would have me as

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: a beast; not that I being a beast she would have me,

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: but that she, being a very beastly creature, lays

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: claim to me.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: What is she?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: A very reverend body, ay, such a

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: one as a man may not speak of without he say

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: “sir-reverence.” I have but lean luck in the match,

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: and yet is she a wondrous fat marriage.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: How dost thou mean a “fat

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: marriage”?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Marry, sir, she’s the kitchen

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: wench, and all grease, and I know not what use to

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: put her to but to make a lamp of her and run from

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: her by her own light. I warrant her rags and the

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: tallow in them will burn a Poland winter. If she lives

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: till doomsday, she’ll burn a week longer than the

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: whole world.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: What complexion is she of?

DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Swart like my shoe, but her face

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: nothing like so clean kept. For why? She sweats. A

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: man may go overshoes in the grime of it.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: That’s a fault that water will

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: mend.

              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: No, sir, ’tis in grain; Noah’s flood

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: could not do it.

ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: What’s her name?

              OF
               
              SYRACUSE

              OF

              OF

              OF

              OF

              OF

text: No longer from head to foot than

speaker:

              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: from hip to hip. She is spherical, like a globe. I

              OF

text: could find out countries in her.

              OF

ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF

text: Marry, sir, in her buttocks. I

DROMIO
               
              OF

text: found it out by the bogs.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Where Scotland?

              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: I found it by the barrenness,

speaker:

              OF

ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF

              SYRACUSE
text: I could find no whiteness in them. But I guess it

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: stood in her chin, by the salt rheum that ran

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: between France and it.

ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Where Spain?

speaker:

              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Faith, I saw it not, but I felt it hot

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: in her breath.

ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Where America, the Indies?

              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: O, sir, upon her nose, all o’erembellished

DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: with rubies, carbuncles, sapphires,

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Spain, who sent whole armadas of carracks to be

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: ballast at her nose.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Where stood Belgia, the

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Netherlands?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: O, sir, I did not look so low. To

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: conclude: this drudge or diviner laid claim to me,

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: called me Dromio, swore I was assured to her, told

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: me what privy marks I had about me, as the mark

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: of my shoulder, the mole in my neck, the great wart

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: on my left arm, that I, amazed, ran from her as a

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF

text: witch.

And
              ,

              think
              ,
